tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V3.1.0.0 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville investigate a fresh crop of scams aimed at parting people from their cash, beginning with hackers intercepting customer accounts with some of the biggest names in the fast food business, leaving the clients to foot the bill. Plus, the devious distraction tactics criminals are using to dupe unsuspecting car owners out of hundreds of pounds, and how companies are failing victims of identity fraud..(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martell Maxwell follow the progress as couples and a father-and-son team tackle renovation projects in Stoke, Liverpool and Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A village becomes the scene of a violent gunfight, firearms officers fear for their lives when confronted by an armed man, and two paramedics are victims of a terrifying attack.(n)

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: Documentary following Scottish Ambulance Service crews in Glasgow and Edinburgh as they respond to 999 calls, including one about a child who has fallen in a loch.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Richard Madley and Stephanie Connell help two teams look for items at the Brackley Antiques Cellar in Northamptonshire, while presenter Eric Knowles views one of the largest shoe collections in the world.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsline
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland.(n)

programme.title: The Indian Doctor
programme.desc: A smallpox epidemic in India prompts Prem's mother-in-law to visit her daughter in Trefelin, Wales, and the husband of whom she does not approve. Meanwhile, local evangelist minister Herbert Todd struggles to keep his teenage daughter Verity under control, and receptionist Gina tries to get her baby baptised. Comedy drama, starring Sanjeev Bhaskar.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their culinary journey through time by celebrating Britain's numerous food festivals. The duo reveal the fascinating stories behind the events and sample some of the dishes on offer.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman heads to Shropshire and Herefordshire to help a recently retired couple with a £550,000 budget find a dream country home that is full of traditional period charm. Nicki also visits the Weston Park Model Air Show.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich brothers come up with alternative designs for the garden of a retired couple in Worcestershire who want to get rid of their unsafe grey slab patio.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore three more treasured family heirlooms, working on a writing bureau, a pair of dancing clogs, and two gold-plated ploughing trophies.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas host the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Life Is Magic
programme.desc: Illusionist Joel M from Bangor, Co Down, takes his conjuring skills to parties and events around the country, helping to create life-changing celebrations that people will talk about for years to come. In the first edition he meets the student formal committee at Our Lady of Lourdes High School in Ballymoney to help plan an epic trick for their formal dance.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Mick's suspicions of Frankie increase when he finds out she is looking after Ollie and he pushes her for answers. Gray is struggling to look after his children and work on Whitney's case - and when it turns out that the first hearing is the same day as Chantelle's funeral, his colleague insists on taking him off the case. Suki finds Jags' jeans covered in blood, and Callum promises Ben he'll be at Lexi's dance recital - only for Thompson to call him into the station yet again.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Thirty-four people died in Australia last year as the worst bushfires in living memory swept across the country , with an area roughly the size of England devastated and thousands of homes destroyed. A year on, Clive Myrie hears from the people living in the path of the fires and the firefighters who risked their lives to save them, and asks if these levels of destruction are to become normal.(n)

programme.title: Me, My Brother and Our Balls
programme.desc: Documentary in which Love Island star Chris Hughes and his brother Ben explore male fertility, looking at why the subject is not taken seriously enough. They meet one of the UK's leading experts for a step-by-step guide to sperm, hear how infertility affects masculinity from a GB Olympic rower, and consider how their fertility struggles could impact on their family, and their girlfriends, in the long term.(n)

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: Like much of the UK's shipbuilding industry, Harland & Wolff suffered a steady decline in recent years and in the summer of 2019 it entered administration - appearing to spell the end of the company after almost 160 years. This documentary tells the inside story of the Belfast workers who helped rescue the company from closure, with access to the workers, union reps, administrators and bosses at the heart of the struggle.(n)

programme.title: Stand Up for Live Comedy
programme.desc: Paddy Raff hosts the showcase for emerging comic talent from Belfast. Rachel Fairburn unpicks the joys of sisterhood, Mary O'Connell explains why she is a bad feminist and Shane Todd breaks down sectarianism over a coffee. Paddy rounds off the show with an insight into what makes a Belfast audience unique.(n)

programme.title: Sunny D
programme.desc: Comedy, written by and starring Dane Baptiste as a frustrated 29-year-old, still living at home with his parents. Dane dreads a party to celebrate his dad's 65th birthday, knowing his relatives are going to have awkward questions about his career and love life. When he tries to boost his confidence with the aid of a bottle of rum, it leads to some awkward revelations and an accidental proposal.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Joe Crowley are in the Lake District to celebrate the 250th anniversary of William Wordsworth's birth, and also mark 50 years of Langdale and Ambleside Mountain Rescue. Plus, Adam Henson find out where he will get the best prices for his rams - online or at a traditional livestock market?(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: Carole Baxter creates a bog garden from scratch in her rural garden and George Anderson is in his allotment, where he checks on his apples and pears. Brian Cunningham puts his no-mow garden to bed for the winter and adds some sparkles of spring interest and Kirsty Wilson is in her flat looking at reviving interest in a plant that has gone out of fashion, the African violet.(n)

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob fish for brown trout on the river Test in Hampshire, using a Victorian fly-casting technique pioneered in the area as well as an authentic 19th-century rod. The Mayflies are hatching, and the famously short-lived insects inspire some thoughts on the ephemeral nature of life, and what they would do if they only had 24 hours left.(n)

programme.title: The Week in Parliament
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's proceedings in Parliament, presented by David Cornock..(n)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Update on politics from Westminster and beyond.(n)

programme.title: Decimate
programme.desc: A team of three must keep the £20,000 cash wall intact by answering questions correctly. However, if they are Decimated, they will leave with nothing. Quiz show, hosted by Shane Richie.(n)

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin is in Nottingham, where vintage fan Melissa Mason and jewellery designer Paolo Moscardini learn the tricks of the buying trade to see who can make the most profit.(n)

programme.title: 800 Words
programme.desc: When Woody and Smiler find yet another thing wrong with the Turners' house they have to evacuate to the motel, where George encounters Dean - a feared nemesis from his childhood.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The sewing room is transported back to the 1960s as the six remaining contestants revive vintage garments, take on time-honoured techniques and wrestle with antique equipment in an attempt to show Patrick Grant and Esme Young they deserve a place in the quarter finals. For their first task they are asked to follow a pattern for a colour block dress, then must work with PVC to transform a rain mac in the alteration challenge, before creating fitted jackets inspired by the era. Claudia Winkleman presents.(n)

programme.title: Gorilla Family and Me
programme.desc: Part one of two. Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan travels to the Democratic Republic of the Congo, where he realises a lifelong dream by spending time with Grauer's gorillas, the largest primates on earth. He meets the fearsome alpha male Chimanuka and two babies, one a lonely orphan and as Gordon gains the trust of these mysterious, seldom seen animals, he discovers their incredible compassion and gets caught up in a battle between giant rival silverbacks for control of the family.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Michael Baggott assess items brought into Newby Hall in North Yorkshire. Mark comes across an interesting Clarice Cliff cake plate and Michael enjoys an ancient Chinese urn. Presenter Paul Martin takes in the splendours of the country house's Adams interiors.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Rick Edwards, Scarlett Moffatt, Naga Munchetty and David O'Doherty test their general knowledge skills on this week's special House of Games: Champion editions.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: James Cosmo narrates a documentary about the port of Peterhead and the people working on land and at sea to put fish on the nation's plates. The fishing boat Reliance, skippered by John Clarke, heads to the Shetland Isles in search of whitefish and prawns, while the Ocean Endeavour ventures to Rockall, one of the UK's most remote fishing grounds, in search of haddock.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales
programme.desc: Adventurer Paul Rose's trip concludes in Wharfedale, where he talks to some of the women whose story inspired the film Calendar Girls, finds out why bats are under threat in the area and meets families from inner-city Bradford who are having their first Dales experience.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: The return of the quiz in which contestants answer questions on specialist subjects and then test their general knowledge.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts another first-round match as shuffleboard players the Sliders take on live entertainment fans the Ticket Collectors. The teams must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of Hoopoe, Kittiwake, Chiffchaff, and Cuckoo.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The penultimate first-round match of the academic quiz sees four students from the University of Edinburgh pitting their wits against a team from the University of Manchester in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: In the Face of Terror
programme.desc: Documentary following the stories of ordinary people fighting for truth and justice following acts of terror. The first one featured is a hostage crisis in Syria that culminated in seven beheadings by a British executioner, later dubbed Jihadi John, while the second looks at the far-right attack in Christchurch, New Zealand, in which 51 people were shot dead in the city's mosques.(n)

programme.title: Croí Uladh le John Toal
programme.desc: John meets Becky Convery and her talented dog, Miley in Maghera. In Omeath, a group of Irish speakers started to make currachs to give themselves a different language focus. John meets Neville McCann and his friends to see the currach that they have made. In Irish.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef takes a culinary break in Bordeaux, where he helps judge a local wine contest and hires a 2CV for an excursion to the coast - abundant with mussels and oysters.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Heroes
programme.desc: The future holds disappointment for Hiro when he discovers that people with secret powers are considered terrorists. As the time-traveller prepares for a showdown with the President he confronts some familiar faces who have changed over the years.(n)
